title: Completion should be able to retrigger completions when accepted
body:
re https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/74054

HTML/CSS completion item sometimes retrigger completions upon insertion. We should make that an editor concept with (1) proper API and (2) a setting to enable/disable this.

body: * I work on a train with spotty internet connection * I see a notification from the update service (but I never interacted with the update service, e.g I never asked to check for updates...)

title: Uncommenting JSX leaves braces around the element
body:
<!-- Please search existing issues to avoid creating duplicates. -->
<!-- Also please test using the latest insiders build to make sure your issue has not already been fixed: https://code.visualstudio.com/insiders/ -->

<!-- Use Help > Report Issue to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version: 1.38.1
- OS Version: Ubuntu 18.04

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Toggle block comment around the JSX element to comment it
`<List />` -> `{/* <List /> */}`
2.Toggle block comment again to uncomment it
`{/* <List /> */}` -> `{<List />}`

As you see, it will leave braces that were not present in the original.
Repeating the above steps once more gives:
`{{<List />}}`

Don't know if the braces can be removed after uncommenting, or would this cause some other errors. But if they can safely be removed than it should be fixed.

title: Proxy Issues with VS Code and Corporate Proxy (Settings.xml seems to be ignored)
body:
So for me to be able to get access to the extension library I need to use the command 
code --proxy-server="192.168.80.3:8080;"

My settings.xml does not seem to apply anything but includes the following just to make my case. That proxy settings in the xml do not apply. 

my settings.xml
{
    "http.systemCertificates": false,
    "http.proxySupport": "off",
    "http.proxyStrictSSL": false

}

title: Cannot type numbers in terminal when switching to Chinese input
body:
Steps to Reproduce:

1. Switch to Chinese input and open terminal.
2. Type number key, the number won't appear. Type same number keys several times then only one number shows up.
3. It occurs on both Powershell and Bash for WSL.

Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?: Yes

Environment:

```
Version: 1.39.0 (user setup)
```

title: Color-picker
body:
I suggest making it possible to call color-picker not hover, but on a hotkey. Because when you disable the display of documentation (which hinders me a lot) also turns off the color-picker, which I really need. 

It turns out that the display documentation and color-picker are tied to the same setting, there is no possibility of disabling something one

Sorry for my English, it's not my native language.

title: Sync data tree show twisty when having no children

* don't implement `hasChildren`
* filter all children of a node
* :bug: the node has twisty

title: Hovering over css color does not open color picker, instead opens MDN reference box.
body:
Issue Type: Bug Hovering over CSS color does not open color picker, instead, it opens the MDN reference box. Earlier (not sure of the exact version, however,) it used to open up a color picker box, which was useful in case the user wants to choose a diff color and play around. I have checked the stable build (with no extensions installed) and able to replicate this issue in it as well. Is this intended behavior? I liked the color picker. not sure if I am missing something here. ![no color picker](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/9264813/66544198-1941c900-eb55-11e9-81c9-7a2dc0985f18.png) VS Code version: Code - Insiders 1.40.0-insider (193fead4103363d1a14873bcf38181d97cf611f6, 2019-10-10T05:26:43.233Z) OS version: Windows_NT x64 10.0.17134 Remote OS version: Linux x64 4.15.0-64-generic

title: Iteration Plan for October 2019
body:
This plan captures our work in **October**. This is a 4-week iteration. We will ship our October Update in **early November**. 

This is our annual issue house keeping iteration. You'll see a large number of GitHub issue notifications over the course of this iteration. If you want to track our progress, the community has us covered: https://vscode-github-stats.netlify.com/

If you are interested in why we have issue house keeping iterations and in our general philosophy around issue management, then we have this [write-up](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/wiki/Issue-Grooming) for you.

## Endgame
- **October 28th, 2019**: Code freeze for the endgame
- **November 1st, 2019**: Endgame done

The endgame details for this iteration are tracked in **TBD**.

## Plan Items
Below is a summary of the top level plan items.

Legend of annotations:

| Mark | Description |
| ------------- | ------------- |
| :runner: | work in progress |
| :hand: | blocked task |
| :muscle: | stretch goal for this iteration |
| :red_circle: | missing issue reference |
| :large_blue_circle: | more investigation required to remove uncertainty |
| :black_circle: | under discussion within the team |

### Housekeeping
- [ ] :runner: Issue/PR Grooming - review, categorization, assignment https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/82032 **team**

### API
- API finalization: [query](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues?q=is%3Aissue+is%3Aopen+milestone%3A%22October+2019%22+label%3A%22api-finalization%22)

### Engineering
- [ ] :runner: Continue exploring upgrade to Electron 6.0 https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/76069 @deepak1556
- [ ] :runner: Adopt `strictPropertyInitialization` https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/78168 **team**
- [ ] :runner: Adopt `enableStrictFunctionTypes` https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/81574 **team**

-------

### Deferred Items
- All work that was in-flight end of September. We'll resume that work in early November.

title: Fixes #48513 - buffers terminal onData events
body:
Adds buffering (throttling) to terminal `onData` events (both for remote and local scenarios)

Closes https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/48513

title: Default workplace settings
body:
Hey all!

I would love to have an easy way to create workplace settings (.vscode/settings.json).

I have a bunch of format_on_save rules + linting rules that I manually move from project to project in .vscode/settings.json. 

My current process is:  go find a recent project, open in finder, copy and paste the .vscode folder into my new project. I'd love it if there was a way to set a default workplace settings.json file and then just apply it. 

I imagine there could be two command palette options:

Create / Edit your default workplace settings.json file
and
Apply workplace settings.json 

Apply would add .vscode/settings.json to the your current directory.

Thanks for the consideration  — keep up the fantastic work!

title: [css] issue with coma separated values

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

body:
<!-- Please search existing issues to avoid creating duplicates. -->
<!-- Also please test using the latest insiders build to make sure your issue has not already been fixed: https://code.visualstudio.com/insiders/ -->

<!-- Use Help > Report Issue to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version: 1.39.0
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create a CSS file with this code:
```css
.test {
    --validValue: , 0 0;
}
@supports not (--validValue: , 0 0) {
  .vscode-parsing-error {
      content: "";
  }
}
```

2. You'll get these errors:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7545075/66519383-d9bfa200-eaac-11e9-96f2-0f07113135aa.png)


<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?: Yes, no extensions installed

title: circuit-board octicon is difficult to read on status bar
body:
Issue Type: Bug The circuit-board octicon is very dense with VS Code 1.39.0, which makes it difficult to identify as a circuit board when it is on the status bar or any other location where it is very small. Unless you look at it very closely, it just looks like a square with some sort of pattern in the center: ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/760836/66517253-69af1d00-eaa8-11e9-8f3f-92a4f28811e8.png) It would be easier to identify as a circuit board if there were fewer traces with larger pads in the center, like with the previous icon. title: Integrated Terminal Appends ^V to the prompt when switching spaces
body:
- VSCode Version: 1.38.1

    Version: 1.38.1
    Commit: b37e54c98e1a74ba89e03073e5a3761284e3ffb0
    Date: 2019-09-11T13:31:32.854Z
    Electron: 4.2.10
    Chrome: 69.0.3497.128
    Node.js: 10.11.0
    V8: 6.9.427.31-electron.0
    OS: Darwin x64 18.7.0

- OS Version: 10.14.6 (18G103)

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open VSCode in fullscreen mode
2. Open another app in the main desktop so that you have two spaces: one desktop, one VSCode
4. Every time you switch between spaces, ^V will be appended to the terminal

Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?: Yes

title: Integrated terminal double click doesn't use comma as word separator
body:
Issue Type: Bug Just echo any words separated by comma and double click and you'll note the selection doesn't use ',' as a word boundary. This is particularly annoying when selecting push tags, branches, etc from a git log: commit abcdefgzagd (HEAD -> myBranch, tag: myBranch-1000, origin/myBranch, origin/HEAD) Double clicking on 'myBranch' will result in a selection of 'myBranch,' This looks similar/partially related to https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/21125, but that bug is explicitly referring to links, whereas this bug is less specific. VS Code version: Code 1.38.1 (b37e54c98e1a74ba89e03073e5a3761284e3ffb0, 2019-09-11T13:31:32.854Z) OS version: Darwin x64 18.7.0 Remote OS version: Linux x64 4.4.0-145-generic
System Info Extension|Author (truncated)|Version ---|---|--- remote-containers|ms-|0.74.0 remote-ssh|ms-|0.46.1 remote-ssh-edit|ms-|0.46.1 remote-ssh-explorer|ms-|0.46.1 remote-wsl|ms-|0.39.5 vscode-remote-extensionpack|ms-|0.17.0 vim|vsc|1.11.0 code-gnu-global|aus|0.2.2 path-intellisense|chr|1.4.2 seito-openfile|Fr4|1.8.5 python|ms-|2019.10.41019 cpptools|ms-|0.26.0-insiders3 multi-command|ryu|1.3.0 clang-format|xav|1.9.0
I'm on a MacBook Pro running MacOS Mojave.

title: Selection highlight does not render in the overview ruler when the language has a document highlight provider
body:
Issue Type: Bug before last update, when i used to highlight a word by selecting it with mouse cursor then i used to get a little square in the side scrollbar for each occurrences of that word. Now, after last update, i'm no longer able to see the occurrences on the sidebar, i can see them if i just click a keyword (like funciton name, or variable) but if i select a part of a word or a word then i get all the occurrences highlited in the document but without little squars on the sidebar. please resolve. VS Code version: Code 1.38.1 (b37e54c98e1a74ba89e03073e5a3761284e3ffb0, 2019-09-11T13:35:15.005Z) OS version: Windows_NT x64 10.0.18362

title: Debugging simple javascript file triggers lengthy download
body: Issue Type: Bug Wanted to step through some simple JS functions and went to kick off a simple node debug session only to have to wait a super long time for OmniSharp and .NET Core Debugger to load. What the heck does C# and .NET core have to do with node debugging? VS Code version: Code 1.38.1 (b37e54c98e1a74ba89e03073e5a3761284e3ffb0, 2019-09-11T13:31:32.854Z) OS version: Darwin x64 18.7.0

title: Files leaked to github by using vscode
body:
Hello,

i am using vscode for my c/c++ development and recently a very strange thing happened. 
one of my source files was sent to public internet(Microsoft, github) without my consent. I have a monitoring app on my machine to alert me when security risks are exposed and that's how i found out about this incident.

the command which triggered this file upload was:

/usr/bin/git->/vscode/code --nolazy --inspect 13242 /vscode/resources/app/out/bootstrap-fork --type=extensionHost

Version: 1.38.1
Commit: b37e54c98e1a74ba89e03073e5a3761284e3ffb0
Date: 2019-09-11T13:30:08.229Z
Electron: 4.2.10
Chrome: 69.0.3497.128
Node.js: 10.11.0
V8: 6.9.427.31-electron.0
OS: Linux x64 3.10.0-693.11.6.el7.x86_64




i wonder if this is related to a crash or some other activities in vscode

thanks
Ali

title: Vs code can't be installed.
body:
